title: Add --wait-until-actionable flag for polling mode
description: Add a flag that blocks until the PR becomes actionable (unresolved thread needing response, or CI failure). Default timeout 30 minutes. On CI failure, recommend using CircleCI MCP server to investigate.
close_reason: Implemented --wait-until-actionable flag with configurable --timeout (default 30min) and --poll-interval (default 30s). PR is actionable when there are unresolved threads needing response or CI failures. Updated CI failure message to recommend CircleCI MCP server for investigation.

title: Fetch job details via CircleCI v1.1 API
description: Use CircleCI API v1.1 endpoint: GET /api/v1.1/project/{vcs}/{owner}/{repo}/{job_number} to get job details including steps array with name and actions (each action has index, step, failed fields). Auth via Circle-Token header.
close_reason: Implemented in circleci.rs: RealCircleCiClient::fetch_job_details() uses v1.1 API

title: GitHub Integration
description: Implement all GitHub-related functionality: detecting repo/PR context, fetching PR status checks, fetching review threads (including resolved status via GraphQL), and posting reply comments with the robot emoji marker.
close_reason: V1 complete: repo/PR auto-detection, status checks via gh CLI, review threads via GraphQL, reply command with resolve support.

title: CircleCI Integration
description: Implement CircleCI log fetching: identify failed jobs from status checks, use v1.1 API for job details, use private API for step logs (output and error streams). Handle rate limiting gracefully.
close_reason: CircleCI integration complete: URL parsing, job details via v1.1 API, step logs via private API, error handling, AI-friendly output

title: Auto-detect repo and PR from git context
description: Detect current GitHub repo by parsing git remote origin URL or using 'gh repo view --json'. Detect current PR by checking if current branch has an associated PR via 'gh pr view --json' or similar. Fall back to --pr/--repo flags if auto-detection fails.
close_reason: Implemented repo/PR auto-detection using gh CLI with DI pattern. TestGitHubClient for testing. Supports CLI overrides via --repo and --pr flags. 15 tests passing.

title: Parse CircleCI job URL from status check
description: Extract CircleCI project slug, pipeline number, and job number from the status check URL. The URL format is typically: https://circleci.com/gh/OWNER/REPO/PIPELINE_NUM or includes workflow/job paths.
close_reason: Implemented in circleci.rs: parse_circleci_url() handles both classic and app.circleci.com URL formats

title: Add env var support for check filters
description: Support PR_LOOP_INCLUDE_CHECKS and PR_LOOP_EXCLUDE_CHECKS environment variables as alternatives to CLI flags, using clap's env attribute.
close_reason: Implemented PR_LOOP_INCLUDE_CHECKS and PR_LOOP_EXCLUDE_CHECKS env var support using clap's env feature. Values are comma-separated.

title: Project Setup & CLI Framework
description: Set up the Rust project structure, CLI argument parsing, and basic configuration handling. This includes cargo new, adding dependencies (clap, reqwest, serde, tokio), and implementing the basic CLI interface with --pr, --repo flags.
close_reason: V1 complete: Rust project initialized, CLI with clap, credential handling with DI pattern.

title: Format AI-friendly output for CI failures
description: DEFERRED: When CI has failed, output should include: job name, failed step name, and truncated/summarized error logs. Focus on the actual error message rather than full build output. Include hints about what file/test failed if parseable. (Blocked on CircleCI log fetching)
close_reason: Implemented in main.rs: print_recommendation shows job/step names, truncated stderr and stdout tail

title: Implement pr-loop tool
description:
Initial implementation of the pr-loop tool. Tool should be written in Rust and use the GitHub and CircleCI APIs. It can expect to have a CIRCLECI_TOKEN env var set, and it should learn a GitHub API token by running `gh auth token`.

When run, it should figure out the GH repo it is running in (maybe the `gh` CLI can help with this) and the current PR number. You can also pass `--pr PR` and `--repo foo/bar` to override. It should look at the PR and decide what a Claude Code which is developing the PR should do next. Things it should look at:

- The status of CI checks on the PR.  There should be flags that lets you include or exclude CI checks to care about.
- If a CircleCI status check failed, why (including logs for the failing step).
- Unresolved PR review thread conversations. See if the latest comment on any of them is not from you yourself. (You will mark all comments you make with an robot emoji and "From Claude:".)

It should print out a brief AI-friendly "next thing to look at", prioritizing "respond to/work on comment" over "deal with CI failures" and "wait for CI to finish" (though if there are both new responses and CI failures it should at least be made aware of it).

It should have a subcommand or flag or something that lets it easily respond to a review comment (with the special emoji stuff mentioned above).
close_reason: V1 complete: PR analysis, review thread handling, CI check monitoring, wait-until-actionable polling, reply command, CircleCI log integration

title: Decision Engine & Output Formatting
description: Implement the logic that analyzes PR state (CI status, review threads) and produces AI-friendly 'next thing to do' output. Prioritize: respond to comments > fix CI failures > wait for CI. Format output concisely for Claude Code consumption.
close_reason: V1 complete: analyze_pr() decision engine, AI-friendly output formatting for all states (comments, CI failures, pending, ready).

title: Handle CircleCI rate limiting and errors
description: Implement graceful handling of 429 rate limit responses and 404 not found errors from CircleCI API. On rate limit, either retry with backoff or skip that job with a warning. On 404, skip gracefully.
close_reason: Implemented in circleci.rs: 404/429 errors handled with bail!, graceful fallback in main.rs

title: Fetch PR status checks via GitHub API
description: Use 'gh pr checks PR --json' or GitHub REST API to get all status checks for the PR. Parse check names, states (pass/fail/pending), and URLs. Support --include-checks and --exclude-checks glob patterns to filter which checks to care about. Focus on CircleCI checks for now; GitHub Actions support deferred.
close_reason: Implemented CI checks fetching via gh pr checks --json. Includes filtering by include/exclude glob patterns, ChecksSummary with failed/pending/all_passed helpers. TestChecksClient for testing. 23 tests passing.

title: Fetch PR review threads via GraphQL
description: Use GitHub GraphQL API to fetch PullRequestReviewThread objects including: isResolved status, comments with body/author/createdAt. Need GraphQL because REST API doesn't expose thread resolution status. Query via 'gh api graphql'.
close_reason: Implemented GraphQL-based review thread fetching via gh api graphql. Fetches thread resolution status, path, line, and all comments with author/body. TestThreadsClient for testing. 26 tests passing.

title: Format output for CI pending/success states
description: When all review comments are addressed and CI is passing, output 'PR is ready - nothing to do'. When CI is pending, output 'Waiting for CI: X checks pending' with names of pending checks.
close_reason: Implemented as part of pr-loop-mpv: NextAction::WaitForCi and NextAction::PrReady cases with appropriate output.

title: Format AI-friendly output for review comments
description: When there are unaddressed review comments, output should include: thread ID (for reply command), file path and line info, the reviewer's comment text, and context about what code is being discussed. Keep it concise but complete.
close_reason: Implemented as part of pr-loop-mpv: print_recommendation() outputs thread ID, file/line location, reviewer comment text with quoting for easy Claude consumption.

title: Implement priority-based decision logic
description: Analyze PR state and determine the single most important next action. Priority order: 1) Respond to unaddressed review comments (highest), 2) Note CI failures (without logs for now), 3) Wait for CI to complete (lowest). Output should mention if multiple categories have items. V1: CI failure details limited to pass/fail status only.
close_reason: Implemented decision engine with analyze_pr() function and NextAction enum. Priority: comments > CI failures > wait for CI > ready. AI-friendly output formatting with actionable thread IDs and check names. 42 tests passing.

title: Implement token/credential handling
description: Read CIRCLECI_TOKEN from environment. Get GitHub token by running 'gh auth token' subprocess. Validate both are available before proceeding.
close_reason: Implemented credential handling with DI pattern. GitHub token via 'gh auth token', CircleCI token from env var. TestCredentialProvider for testing. 9 tests passing.

title: Implement CLI argument parsing
description: Use clap to implement CLI with: --pr PR_NUMBER (optional), --repo OWNER/REPO (optional), --include-checks PATTERN (optional, repeatable, glob), --exclude-checks PATTERN (optional, repeatable, glob). Add subcommand 'reply' with --thread THREAD_ID and --message MESSAGE flags. Future: support config via env vars/file.
close_reason: Implemented CLI with clap: --repo, --pr, --include-checks, --exclude-checks flags, plus 'reply' subcommand with --thread, --message, --resolve. 7 tests passing.

title: Implement reply subcommand for posting comments
description: Implement 'pr-loop reply --thread THREAD_ID --message MESSAGE' subcommand. Prepends 'ðŸ¤– From Claude:' to message body. Uses GitHub API to post as reply to the specified review thread. May also support --resolve flag to mark thread resolved after reply.
close_reason: Implemented reply subcommand with GraphQL mutations: addPullRequestReviewThreadReply for posting, resolveReviewThread for --resolve flag. Message prefixed with Claude marker. TestReplyClient for testing. 46 tests passing.

title: Identify threads needing response
description: For each unresolved review thread, check if the last comment contains the 'ðŸ¤– From Claude:' marker. If last comment does NOT have this marker, this thread needs a response. Track comment IDs for reply functionality.
close_reason: Implemented thread response detection: needs_response() checks if unresolved thread's last comment has 'ðŸ¤– From Claude:' marker. find_actionable_threads() filters to threads needing response. ActionableThread with location formatting. 34 tests passing.

title: Fetch step logs via CircleCI private API
description: Use CircleCI private API endpoints to get step output: GET /api/private/output/raw/{vcs}/{owner}/{repo}/{job_num}/output/{task_index}/{step_id} for stdout, and .../error/... for stderr. Filter to failed steps only for efficiency.
close_reason: Implemented in circleci.rs: RealCircleCiClient::fetch_step_output() uses private API

title: Initialize Rust project with Cargo
description: Run cargo new pr-loop, set up Cargo.toml with initial dependencies: clap (CLI parsing), reqwest (HTTP client with TLS), serde/serde_json (JSON), tokio (async runtime), anyhow (error handling).
close_reason: Initialized Rust project with Cargo. Added dependencies: clap, tokio, reqwest, serde, serde_json, anyhow, glob. Build and tests pass.
